result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Piasecki-Chamberlain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J. Piasecki-Chamberlain is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas J. Piasecki-Chamberlain was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
per Lindsey @ ONSO - in custody - OSNO
(Wf added)
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
from PO to Judge - not requesting anything

4:13 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Voorhees states he spoke by telephone with defendant and PO agent. Voorhees requests more time to pay or to return application for payment plan. Court states that defendant has been making regular payments; but they were going to other cases. Adj. 4:16 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
per Br II - Ok to add this to payment plan - will leave on the 6-20 review date - at that time Court will decide if still expunging or not

11:46 am. Defendant Thomas J. Piasecki-Chamberlain in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to a Misdemeanor Criminal Tresspass to Dwelling - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea Questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 6 months
Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
CC/DNA Surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Make reasonable effort to obtain GED/HSED.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Special disposition under 973.015 if defendant successfully completes probation and pays all fines/costs/surcharges.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 12:04 pm  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

No contact with Matthew Smith. SUBMIT TO BOOKING.

2:38 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Piasecki-Chamberlain in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Schiek/Voorhees statement to bond. Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:40 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 11:30 am.
